Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: storyboard
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Reference to the storyboard the SegueCoordinator work with.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: rootNavigationController
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Root navigation controller that was passed into initializer of SegueCoordinator.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: init(storyboardName:rootNavigationController:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Typically, you should override this initializer and specify storyboard name.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: pop(animated:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Pops view controller from the stack of the current navigation controller.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: closeModal(animated:completion:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Dismiss current modal view controller.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: unwindToFirst(type:animated:completion:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: This method will make a transition to the farthest matching controller. It performs searching for the first view controller matching the specified type. Then it closes all modal view controllers above the found view controller’s stack and pops navigation stack to make the found view controller the top. In other words, the found view controller becomes the top and visible.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: unwindToLast(type:animated:completion:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: This method will make a transition to the closest matching controller. It performs searching for the last view controller matching the specified type. Then it closes all modal view controllers above the found view controller’s stack and pops navigation stack to make the found view controller the top. In other words, the found view controller becomes the top and visible.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: unwindToFirst(animated:where:completion:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: This method will make a transition to the farthest matching controller. It performs searching for the first view controller matching the specified predicate. Then it closes all modal view controllers above the found view controller’s stack and pops navigation stack to make the found view controller the top. In other words, the found view controller becomes the top and visible.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: unwindToLast(animated:where:completion:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: This method will make a transition to the closest matching controller. It performs searching for the last view controller matching the specified predicate. Then it closes all modal view controllers above the found view controller’s stack and pops navigation stack to make the found view controller the top. In other words, the found view controller becomes the top and visible.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: unwindToController(_:animated:completion:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Closes all modal view controllers above the specified view controller’s stack and pops navigation stack to make it the top. In other words, the specified view controller becomes the top and visible.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: instantiateInitial(type:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Create initial view controller from storyboard.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: instantiate(_:type:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Create view controller from storyboard by identifier.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: modalInitial(type:style:wrapInNavigationController:animated:prepareController:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Create the initial view controller from the storyboard and present it modally from the current navigation controller.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: modal(_:type:style:wrapInNavigationController:animated:prepareController:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Create the view controller from the storyboard by identifier and present it modally from the current navigation controller.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: modalController(_:style:wrapInNavigationController:animated:prepareController:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Present controller modally from the current navigation controller.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: pushInitial(type:animated:prepareController:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Create the initial view controller from the storyboard and push it to the stack of the current navigation controller.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: push(_:type:animated:prepareController:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Create the view controller from the storyboard by identifier and push it to the stack of the current navigation controller.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: pushController(_:animated:prepareController:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Push view controller to the stack of the current navigation controller.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: findFirst(type:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: This method will search the controller by its type. Search for view controller is starting on the navigation stack of the root navigation controller. Then the search continues on the navigation stack of the presented view controller and so on. This method will return the first view controller that will fulfill the conditions of the search. In other words, it returns the farthest to the current view controller in the navigation stack.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: findFirst(where:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: This method will search the controller with custom conditions declared in the predicate. Search for view controller is starting on the navigation stack of the root navigation controller. Then the search continues on the navigation stack of the presented view controller and so on. This method will return the first view controller that will fulfill the conditions of the search. In other words, it returns the farthest to the current view controller in the navigation stack.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: findLast(type:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: This method will search the controller by its type. Search for view controller starting on the navigation stack of the root navigation controller. Search for view controller is starting on the navigation stack of the root navigation controller. Then the search continues on the navigation stack of the presented view controller and so on. This method will return the last view controller that will fulfill the conditions of the search. In other words, it returns the nearest to the current view controller in the navigation stack.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: findLast(where:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: This method will search the controller with custom conditions declared in the predicate. Search for view controller is starting on the navigation stack of the root navigation controller. Then the search continues on the navigation stack of the presented view controller and so on. This method will return the last view controller that will fulfill the conditions of the search. In other words, it returns the nearest to the current view controller in the navigation stack.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: segue(_:type:prepareController:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Perform segue from currently presented view controller

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: setInitial(type:prepareController:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Create the initial view controller from the storyboard and make it the root of the rop navigation controller.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: set(_:type:prepareController:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Create the view controller from the storyboard by identifier and make it the root of the top navigation controller.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: setController(_:prepareController:)
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Make view controller the root of the top navigation controller.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: topController
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Returns top view controller.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.name: topNavigationController
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html#/s:16Segue.abstract: Returns navigation controller of top view controller if it exists. Returns nil otherwise.

Classes/SegueCoordinator.html.name: SegueCoordinator
Classes/SegueCoordinator.html.abstract: Builds on top of the storyboard and encapsulates navigation logic. View controllers delegates navigation requests to it and SegueCoordinator performs all required transitions as well as data transfer. Typically you should use its subclasses instead.
